ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I will recommend.
It is mandatory. So my recommendation does not matter.
Fairly formulaic information, but necessary for being sensitive to graduate school ethical issues. It's a required course, so it's not really my place to recommend it for another student.
Friday morning required course.
Of course, because we learn researchers' duties in this class.
It is helpful

While the course is required, it offers a great look into ethics and makes you think about "simple" issues in a more complex way. Go in with an open mind and be ready to talk about some interesting things.
It is right that we should all take it. Sure
Yes.
The course provides a nice overview of key things we must know as researchers, including what constitutes human subject research and the associated clearances we must get.
Show up and listen
This course covered the responsible conduct of research. It is required by NSF and other federal agencies so I would definitely recommend this course. It is mandatory.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: very helpful.
I did not know exactly how to cite other papers in my paper and how to get a permit to use other people's research result. This class helped me out.
It certainly provided a useful perspective on issues that are important and pervasive throughout academia and industry. I'm sure I will use the work learned here throughout my career.
We know the bottom line, bad examples and good practices.
it helped me to understand the ethical complications of my discipline.
This provided us with some background regarding how we should proceed with our research from a nuts-and-bolts perspective such as "what constitutes sufficient work for authorship"
Gave me valuable insight into ethical code of conduct for writing scientific articles
This course highlighted the ethical and moral implications of research. It emphasized how important character is to sound academic studies.
The course informed me of laws specific to Yale and research which I was not aware of previously.
